instruction: 1. Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 2-3 minutes, then drain and blend into a smooth puree.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions, and cook until golden brown.
3. Add minced garlic and ginger, cook until fragrant, then add the spinach puree.
4. Add turmeric, garam masala, and salt, and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
5. Add cubed paneer and cook for another 3-5 minutes until paneer is well coated.
6. Garnish with fresh cream if desired, and serve with naan or rice.
1. Marinate the chicken with yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, and chili powder for at least 1 hour.
2. Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked about 80% through and set aside.
3. In a pan, heat butter, add chopped onions, and cook until golden.
4. Add garlic, ginger, and chopped tomatoes, cooking until soft and oil separates.
5. Blend the mixture to a smooth puree, return to pan, add the chicken, cream, and garam masala.
6. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, garnish with cream, and serve hot with naan or rice.
1. Heat oil in a pot, add green curry paste, and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
2. Add coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
3. Add sliced vegetables and cook until they are tender.
4. Add fresh basil and season with salt and sugar.
5. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice.
ingredients: 1 cup assorted vegetables (bell pepper, zucchini, carrots)

instruction: 1. Cook lasagna sheets according to package instructions and set aside.
2. In a pan, cook minced meat with onion and garlic until browned.
3. Add tomato sauce, salt, and spices, and simmer for 15 minutes.
4. In a baking dish, layer meat sauce, lasagna sheets, béchamel sauce, and cheese.
5. Repeat layers and finish with a generous layer of cheese on top.
6. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25-30 minutes until golden brown and bubbly.
ingredients: 2 cups shredded cheese (mozzarella and parmesan blend)

instruction: 1. In a pan, sauté vegetables in oil with soy sauce until just tender.
2. Let the filling cool, then place a small portion on each spring roll wrapper.
3. Fold and roll the wrappers tightly, sealing the edges with a paste of water and flour.
4. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry rolls until golden and crispy.
5. Serve hot with soy sauce or chili sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup assorted vegetables (cabbage, carrots, bell pepper, julienned)
1 tbsp flour mixed with water (for sealing)

instruction: 1. Crush graham crackers and mix with melted butter to form a crust. Press into a pan.
2. Beat cream cheese, sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
3. Pour the mixture over the crust and smooth the top.
4. Bake at 160°C (320°F) for 45 minutes, then let cool.
5. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.
1. Mix butter, minced garlic, and herbs in a bowl.
2. Spread the mixture over bread slices and sprinkle with cheese.
3. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 10 minutes or until golden and crispy.
4. Serve hot as a starter.
1. Roll out pizza dough and spread tomato sauce over it.
2. Sprinkle cheese and add toppings of choice.
3. Bake at 220°C (430°F) for 10-12 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and crust is golden.
4. Serve hot.
1. Boil lentils with salt and turmeric until soft.
2. Heat oil, add cumin seeds, garlic, and cook until garlic is golden.
3. Pour the tempering over cooked lentils and mix well.
4. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with rice.
1. Soak chickpeas overnight and boil until tender.
2. In a pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, and spices, then add chickpeas and cook until flavors are blended.
3. For bhature, mix flour with yogurt and water to form a dough. Roll out and deep fry until golden.
4. Serve hot with chole.
Marinate mutton with yogurt, spices (such as garam masala, turmeric, cumin, and coriander), and salt for at least 1 hour.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add basmati rice with a pinch of salt. Cook the rice until it's 70% cooked and drain.
In a separate pan, sauté sliced onions until golden brown, then add the marinated mutton and cook until the meat is tender.
Layer the cooked rice and mutton, sprinkle fried onions on top, cover, and cook on low heat until the flavors meld together, around 15-20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita or salad.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, drain and set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until they turn pink, then remove and set aside.
In the same wok, add garlic and vegetables (carrot, bell pepper, bean sprouts) and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add the noodles to the pan and pour in a mixture of soy sauce, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar. Stir everything together.
Add cooked shrimp and crushed peanuts. Toss everything together until the noodles are well coated.
Garnish with cilantro, lime wedges, and additional peanuts before serving.
ingredients: Vegetables (Carrot, Bell Pepper, etc.) - 1 cup, thinly sliced

instruction: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
In a pan, fry diced pancetta over medium heat until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated parmesan cheese, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pan with pancetta and toss to coat in the rendered fat.
Quickly pour the egg mixture over the pasta while tossing vigorously to create a creamy sauce. Add pasta water as needed to achieve a smooth texture.
Serve with extra parmesan and pepper.
Cut pork into bite-sized pieces, season with salt and pepper, then dredge in cornstarch.
Heat oil in a wok or deep pan. Fry the pork pieces until golden and crispy, then remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add pineapple chunks, bell peppers, and onions. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add vinegar, sugar, and ketchup to create the sauce. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Return the fried pork to the pan, tossing it in the sauce until well-coated and heated through.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a baking pan.
Melt chocolate and butter together in a microwave or double boiler, then set aside to cool.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and sugar until combined, then stir in the melted chocolate mixture.
Add flour and mix until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs.
Let cool before cutting into squares and serving with ice cream.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Clean mushrooms and remove stems. Chop the stems finely and set aside.
In a skillet, sauté garlic and chopped mushroom stems in olive oil until softened. Add breadcrumbs and cheese and stir to combine.
Stuff each mushroom cap with the mixture, pressing gently to pack it in.
Place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden and bubbling.
Garnish with fresh herbs and serve hot.
Cook sushi rice according to package instructions, then season with vinegar, sugar, and salt.
Lay a sheet of nori (seaweed) on a bamboo mat. Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a small margin at the top.
Add thinly sliced fish and any other fillings like cucumber or avocado.
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat. Seal the edge with a little water.
Slice into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
Soak kidney beans overnight. Drain and cook the beans in a pressure cooker with water and salt until soft.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until translucent. Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add spices (turmeric, garam masala, cumin) and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the cooked kidney beans to the spice mixture and simmer for 10 minutes. Adjust seasoning and consistency as needed.
Serve the rajma with steamed rice.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions and garlic until soft.
Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets, then cook for a few minutes.
Add spices (turmeric, coriander, cumin) and stir to coat the vegetables.
Cover and cook until the potatoes and cauliflower are tender. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, and spices to create a marinade.
Coat the fish pieces with the marinade and let them sit for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill or oven to medium-high heat.
Place the marinated fish on the grill and cook for 5-7 minutes on each side or until fully cooked.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and a side of mint chutney.
In a pot, bring water to a boil and add lemongrass stalks, lime leaves, and chili to infuse the broth with flavors.
Add shrimp to the boiling water and cook for 3-4 minutes or until pink and cooked through.
Add sliced mushrooms to the broth and simmer for another 2-3 minutes.
Stir in lime juice to balance the flavors and adjust the seasoning with fish sauce or salt as needed.
Serve hot with fresh cilantro and chili slices on top.
Boil pasta in salted water according to package instructions until al dente.
In a separate pan, melt butter over medium heat and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add cream to the garlic butter and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally.
Add Parmesan cheese and stir until the sauce thickens.
Toss the cooked pasta into the sauce until well coated.
Serve with a sprinkle of fresh Parmesan and chopped parsley.
Prepare your dumpling wrappers by laying them out on a clean surface.
Stuff each wrapper with a mixture of your choice of meat (like pork or chicken) and vegetables.
Fold and seal the dumplings carefully, ensuring the edges are pinched tightly.
Set up a steamer and bring water to a boil.
Place the dumplings in the steamer and steam for 10-15 minutes, or until fully cooked.
Serve with soy sauce or a dipping sauce of your choice.
Brew strong coffee and let it cool.
Dip the ladyfingers in the coffee for a few seconds and layer them at the bottom of a dish.
Whisk together mascarpone, eggs, and sugar until smooth.
Spread the mascarpone mixture over the coffee-soaked ladyfingers.
Repeat the layers of ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture.
Dust the top with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.
Toast the bread slices until golden brown and crispy.
Chop the tomatoes and garlic, then mix them in a bowl.
Add olive oil, fresh basil, salt, and pepper to the tomato mixture.
Spoon the mixture onto the toasted bread slices.
Serve immediately while the bread is warm.
Form the beef into patties, seasoning with salt and pepper.
Grill the patties over medium heat for 4-5 minutes on each side or until cooked to your preferred doneness.
Toast the buns on the grill for 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Place the cooked patty on the bottom bun and add desired toppings like cheese, lettuce, onions, and tomatoes.
Top with the other bun and serve with fries or your choice of sides.
Boil the eggs in water for 10 minutes and peel them.
Heat oil in a pan, then sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until softened.
Add chopped tomatoes, spices, and cook until the tomatoes break down.
Add water to make a gravy and bring it to a simmer.
Gently add the boiled eggs to the curry and cook for 5 minutes to absorb the flavors.
Serve with rice or naan.
Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Blend the mixture to make a smooth gravy.
Add paneer cubes, cream, and spices, then simmer the curry for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.
Marinate chicken pieces with spices, yogurt, and cornflour for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the chicken in batches until golden and crispy.
Drain the fried chicken on paper towels to remove excess oil.
In a separate pan, sauté curry leaves and green chilies.
Toss the fried chicken in the sautéed mixture and serve hot.
Start by peeling and shredding the papaya into thin strips. You can use a grater or a julienne slicer.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded papaya with chopped chili and crushed peanuts.
In a small bowl, mix fish sauce, lime juice, and a pinch of sugar to create the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the papaya mixture and toss everything together. Adjust the seasoning to your taste.
Serve immediately with additional peanuts and lime wedges on the side for garnish.
Begin by marinating the chicken pieces in a mixture of yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for at least an hour.
In a pan, melt butter over medium heat, then sauté onions until golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook until browned on all sides.
Add pureed tomatoes and cook the mixture for about 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Stir in cream and more butter to create a smooth, rich sauce.
Simmer for another 10 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thick and creamy.
Serve the butter chicken with naan or rice, garnished with fresh coriander leaves.
Rinse the rice and lentils thoroughly before starting.
In a pot, heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add the rice and lentils to the pot and stir to coat them with ghee.
Add water and spices, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer until the rice and lentils are cooked.
Serve hot with a side of yogurt or pickle.
1. Cut the paneer into cubes and set aside.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and oil.
3. Add the paneer cubes to the marinade and let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
4. Preheat the grill or oven.
5. Grill the paneer pieces until golden brown, turning occasionally.
6. Serve hot with mint chutney and sliced onions.
1. Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
2. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
3. Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
4. Add the ground spices and cashews, then mix well.
5. Stir in the yogurt and coconut milk, and cook for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
6. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.
1. Boil and mash the potatoes.
2. Heat oil in a pan, and sauté cumin seeds, followed by onions, green chilies, and spices.
3. Add peas and cook for 5 minutes.
4. Mix the cooked vegetables with the mashed potatoes, then set aside to cool.
5. Take a samosa wrapper, fold it into a cone, and fill with the vegetable mixture.
6. Seal the edges and deep-fry the samosas until golden brown.
1. Heat oil in a large pan and sauté onions until soft.
2. Add the curry paste and cook for a couple of minutes.
3. Add the meat, potatoes, and coconut milk, then bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat and simmer until the meat is tender and the potatoes are soft.
5. Stir in peanuts, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and brown sugar.
6. Simmer for another 10 minutes before serving.
1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
3. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough.
4. Tear the mozzarella into chunks and scatter over the sauce.
5. Add fresh basil leaves on top.
6. Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden.
1. Peel and chop the mangoes, then blend them into a smooth puree.
2. Mix in the sugar and lime juice, adjusting to taste.
3. Pour the mixture into a shallow dish and freeze for 4 hours, stirring every 30 minutes.
4. Once the sorbet is frozen, scoop and serve.
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté whole spices (cinnamon, cloves, bay leaves).
3. Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, and yogurt, then cook until the mixture thickens.
5. Add mixed vegetables, biryani masala, and cook until vegetables are tender.
6. Layer the cooked rice over the vegetable mixture and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes.
1. Marinate the chicken thighs with garlic, yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, and spices for at least 2 hours.
2. Grill the chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
3. Warm pita bread and slice the chicken into strips.
4. Serve the chicken with tahini sauce, tomatoes, and lettuce in the pita.
1. Soak chickpeas overnight and grind them with parsley, garlic, and spices.
2. Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
3. Heat oil in a deep fryer or pan and deep-fry the falafel until golden brown.
4. Serve with pita bread and tahini sauce.
1. Heat the curry paste in a pan until fragrant.
2. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
3. Add vegetables or chicken, and cook until tender.
4. Stir in fresh basil leaves and cook for another minute.
5. Serve with steamed rice.
1. Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions.
2. In a pan, melt butter and sauté garlic until fragrant.
3. Add cream and bring to a simmer.
4. Stir in parmesan cheese until the sauce thickens.
5. Toss the cooked fettuccine pasta with the sauce and serve.
1. Dissolve gelatin in cold water.
2. Heat cream and sugar in a saucepan, then stir in vanilla extract.
3. Add the gelatin mixture to the cream and mix until well combined.
4. Pour into serving glasses and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
5. Top with fresh berries before serving.
1. Roast the eggplant over an open flame or in the oven until the skin is charred.
2. Peel the skin off the eggplant and mash the flesh.
3. In a pan, sauté onions and garlic until golden brown.
4. Add tomatoes and cook until soft, then stir in spices.
5. Add the mashed eggplant to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes.
6. Serve with roti or rice.
1. Marinate the fish with spices and garlic.
2. In a pan, heat oil and cook the fish until browned.
3. Add coconut milk and tamarind, and cook until the gravy thickens.
4. Simmer for 10-15 minutes and serve with rice.
1. Cut mozzarella into sticks.
2. Dip the sticks in flour, then beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.
3. Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry the mozzarella sticks until golden brown.
4. Serve with marinara sauce.
1. Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry the chicken until browned.
2. Add garlic and chilies, and sauté for a minute.
3. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Add fresh basil leaves and cook until wilted.
5. Serve with steamed jasmine rice.
1. Boil the potatoes until soft, then mash them.
2. Mix the mashed potatoes with flour, eggs, and parmesan to form a dough.
3. Roll the dough into small pieces and form gnocchi.
4. Cook the gnocchi in boiling water until they float to the top.
5. Toss with butter and parmesan and serve.
Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl over simmering water or in the microwave.
Whip the cream until soft peaks form.
Fold the melted chocolate into the whipped cream gently until fully combined.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to set into a mousse consistency.
Serve chilled and garnish with chocolate shavings or whipped cream.
Prepare the gram flour fritters by mixing gram flour, water, and spices into a thick batter.
Heat oil in a frying pan and drop spoonfuls of the batter to fry until golden brown.
For the curry, whisk yogurt and water together in a pot, adding in turmeric, chili powder, and other spices.
Heat the curry mixture and bring it to a boil, then simmer.
Add the fried fritters into the curry and cook for 5-10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or roti.
Mix yogurt, lemon juice, and spices to create the marinade.
Coat the chicken pieces evenly with the marinade and let them sit for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Preheat the grill or oven to a high heat.
Place the marinated chicken on the grill or in the oven and cook until the chicken is tender and slightly charred.
Baste with oil or butter halfway through the cooking process to keep the chicken moist.
Serve hot with a side of naan or rice.
Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) or heat oil for frying.
Season the chicken wings with your choice of spices and coat them with a little oil.
Place the wings on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes or until crispy, or fry them in hot oil for about 10-12 minutes.
For sauce, melt butter and mix with hot sauce and minced garlic.
Toss the cooked wings in the sauce and serve immediately.
Cook rice ahead of time and let it cool down or use leftover rice for better texture.
Heat a pan or wok and add oil to stir-fry garlic and vegetables.
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and scramble the eggs on the other side.
Add the cooled rice to the pan and mix everything together.
Pour soy sauce over the rice and stir in some Thai spices to taste.
Stir-fry for another few minutes until everything is well combined and heated through.
Serve with a garnish of fresh herbs and lime wedges.
In a pan, sauté onions and garlic in butter until soft.
Add the arborio rice and stir until it becomes translucent.
Gradually add broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until the liquid is absorbed.
Continue adding broth until the rice is tender and creamy.
Stir in parmesan cheese, butter, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with extra cheese or herbs.
Peel, core, and slice apples into thin slices.
Toss the apple slices with sugar, flour, cinnamon, and lemon juice.
Roll out the pastry and line a pie dish with the dough.
Fill the pastry with the apple mixture and cover with another layer of dough.
Seal the edges and cut slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45-50 minutes or until golden brown.
Let it cool before serving, optionally with vanilla ice cream.
Boil and mash the potatoes, then mix with spices and chopped onions.
Knead the dough for the flatbread with flour, water, and a pinch of salt.
Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them out.
Place a spoonful of the potato mixture in the center of the dough ball and seal it.
Roll it out gently into a round shape, being careful not to tear the dough.
Cook the paratha on a griddle, adding butter on both sides until golden and crispy.
Make a paste by blending spices like cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garlic with a little water.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the paste until fragrant.
Add coconut milk and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Add the fish pieces to the curry and cook until the fish is tender.
Add tamarind pulp for tanginess and adjust seasoning with salt and sugar.
Serve with rice or bread, garnished with fresh cilantro.
Prepare the filling by sautéing vegetables or meat with garlic and spices.
Soften rice paper wrappers by dipping them in warm water.
Place a small amount of filling in the center of each wrapper.
Roll the wrapper tightly, folding in the sides as you go.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the spring rolls until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.
Stir-fry wide rice noodles in a hot pan with a little oil.
Add soy sauce and stir well to coat the noodles.
Add vegetables like broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers.
Push the noodles to the side and crack eggs into the pan, scrambling them.
Toss everything together until the noodles are well coated and cooked through.
Serve hot with a sprinkle of chili flakes if desired.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Layer cooked pasta sheets with meat sauce, cheese, and tomato sauce.
Repeat the layers, finishing with a layer of cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
Let it sit for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
Soak ladyfingers in strong coffee, then arrange them in a dish.
Layer mascarpone cream mixture over the soaked ladyfingers.
Repeat the layers until the dish is filled.
Dust with cocoa powder on top.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight, to let the flavors meld together.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic and spices.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add peas and paneer cubes to the pan and mix well.
Pour in water to create a gravy and simmer until peas are tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with roti or rice.
Heat oil and sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add lamb pieces and brown them on all sides.
Add yogurt, tomatoes, and spices to the lamb and cook for 10-15 minutes.
Pour in water and simmer until the lamb is tender and the sauce thickens.
Serve with steamed rice and garnish with cilantro.
Bake potatoes until tender, then cut them in half and scoop out most of the flesh.
Stuff the potato skins with cheese and crumbled bacon.
Place them on a baking sheet and bake until the cheese is melted and golden.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of chives.
Bring water to a boil in a pot with lemongrass, chilies, and lime leaves.
Add shrimp and cook until they turn pink.
Add mushrooms, fish sauce, and lime juice to the broth.
Simmer for a few minutes and adjust seasoning with salt, sugar, or more lime juice.
Serve hot with a garnish of cilantro and extra lime wedges.
Toast slices of bread until golden and crispy.
Top the toast with a mixture of chopped tomatoes, garlic, and basil.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately as a starter or snack.
Crush biscuits and mix with melted butter to form a base in a pie dish.
Layer sliced bananas over the biscuit base.
Spread caramel over the bananas and top with whipped cream.
Chill in the fridge for a few hours before serving.
